001package io.jstach.jstachio;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004
005import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.NonNull;
006import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
007
008/**
009 * A singleton like decorator for appendables that has additional methods for dealing with
010 * native types used to output variables that have been formatted. This interface is
011 * mostly an internal detail for performance and generally direct implementations are
012 * unnecessary.
013 *
014 * <p>
015 * When a template outputs an <strong>escaped</strong> variable the callstack is as
016 * follows:
017 *
018 * <pre>
019 * formatter --&gt; escaper --&gt; appendable
020 * </pre>
021 *
022 * When a template outputs an <strong>unescaped</strong> variable the callstack is as
023 * follows:
024 *
025 * <pre>
026 * formatter --&gt; appender --&gt; appendable
027 * </pre>
028 *
029 * When a template outputs anything else (e.g. HTML markup) it writes directly to the
030 * appendable.
031 *
032 * @apiNote <strong>Important:</strong> <em> The interface while public is currently
033 * sealed. If you would like to see it unsealed to allow control of intercepting unescaped
034 * variable output please file an issue.</em> Unlike an Appendable this class is expected
035 * to be reused so state should be avoided and implementations should be thread safe.
036 * @author agentgt
037 * @param <A> the appendable
038 * @see Escaper
039 */
040public sealed interface Appender<A extends Appendable> permits Escaper, DefaultAppender, StringAppender {
041
042        /**
043         * Analogous to {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence)}.
044         * @param a appendable to write to. Always non null.
045         * @param s unlike appendable always non null.
046         * @throws IOException if an error happens while writting to the appendable
047         * @apiNote Implementations are required to implement this method.
048         */
049        public void append(A a, CharSequence s) throws IOException;
050
051        /**
052         * Analogous to {@link Appendable#append(CharSequence, int, int)}.
053         * @param a appendable to write to. Never null.
054         * @param csq Unlike appendable never null.
055         * @param start start inclusive
056         * @param end end exclusive
057         * @throws IOException if an error happens while writting to the appendable
058         * @apiNote Implementations are required to implement this method.
059         */
060        public void append(A a, CharSequence csq, int start, int end) throws IOException;
061
062        /**
063         * Appends a character to an appendable.
064         * @param a appendable to write to. Never null.
065         * @param c character
066         * @throws IOException if an error happens while writting to the appendable
067         * @apiNote Implementations are required to implement this method.
068         */
069        public void append(A a, char c) throws IOException;
070
071        /**
072         * Write a short by using {@link String#valueOf(int)}
073         * @param a appendable to write to. Never null.
074         * @param s short
075         * @throws IOException if an error happens while writting to the appendable
076         */
077        default void append(A a, short s) throws IOException {
078                append(a, String.valueOf(s));
079        }
080
081        /**
082         * Write a int by using {@link String#valueOf(int)}.
083         * <p>
084         * Implementations should override if they want different behavior or able to support
085         * appendables that can write the native type.
086         * @param a appendable to write to. Never null.
087         * @param i int
088         * @throws IOException if an error happens while writting to the appendable
089         */
090        default void append(A a, int i) throws IOException {
091                append(a, String.valueOf(i));
092        }
093
094        /**
095         * Write a long by using {@link String#valueOf(long)}.
096         * <p>
097         * Implementations should override if they want different behavior or able to support
098         * appendables that can write the native type.
099         * @param a appendable to write to. Never null.
100         * @param l long
101         * @throws IOException if an error happens while writting to the appendable
102         */
103        default void append(A a, long l) throws IOException {
104                append(a, String.valueOf(l));
105        }
106
107        /**
108         * Write a long by using {@link String#valueOf(long)}.
109         * <p>
110         * Implementations should override if they want different behavior or able to support
111         * appendables that can write the native type.
112         * @param a appendable to write to. Never null.
113         * @param d double
114         * @throws IOException if an error happens while writting to the appendable
115         */
116        default void append(A a, double d) throws IOException {
117                append(a, String.valueOf(d));
118        }
119
120        /**
121         * Write a long by using {@link String#valueOf(long)}.
122         * <p>
123         * Implementations should override if they want different behavior or able to support
124         * appendables that can write the native type.
125         * @param a appendable to write to. Never null.
126         * @param b boolean
127         * @throws IOException if an error happens while writting to the appendable
128         */
129        default void append(A a, boolean b) throws IOException {
130                append(a, String.valueOf(b));
131        }
132
133        /**
134         * Decorates an appendable with this appender such that the returned appendable will
135         * call the this appender which will then write to the inputted appendable.
136         * @param appendable never null.
137         * @return Appendable never null.
138         */
139        default Appendable toAppendable(A appendable) {
140                return new AppenderAppendable<>(this, appendable);
141        }
142
143        /**
144         * Default appender simply passes the contents unchanged to the Appendable.
145         * @return a passthrough appender
146         */
147        public static Appender<Appendable> defaultAppender() {
148                return DefaultAppender.INSTANCE;
149        }
150
151        /**
152         * An appender that will directly call StringBuilder methods for native types.
153         * <p>
154         * This is a low level utility appender for where performance matters.
155         * @return an appender specifically for {@link StringBuilder}
156         */
157        public static Appender<StringBuilder> stringAppender() {
158                return StringAppender.INSTANCE;
159        }
160
161}
162
163/**
164 * Default appender simply passes the contents unchanged to the Appendable.
165 * @author agentgt
166 *
167 */
168enum DefaultAppender implements Appender<Appendable> {
169
170        /**
171         * Singleton instance
172         */
173        INSTANCE;
174
175        @Override
176        public void append(Appendable a, CharSequence s) throws IOException {
177                a.append(s);
178        }
179
180        @Override
181        public void append(Appendable a, CharSequence csq, int start, int end) throws IOException {
182                a.append(csq, start, end);
183        }
184
185        @Override
186        public void append(Appendable a, char c) throws IOException {
187                a.append(c);
188        }
189
190}
191
192/**
193 * An appender that will directly call StringBuilder methods for native types.
194 * <p>
195 * This is a low level utility class for where performance matters.
196 *
197 * @author agentgt
198 *
199 */
200enum StringAppender implements Appender<StringBuilder> {
201
202        /**
203         * Singleton instance
204         */
205        INSTANCE;
206
207        /**
208         * {@inheritDoc}
209         */
210        @Override
211        public void append(StringBuilder a, CharSequence s) {
212                a.append(s);
213        }
214
215        /**
216         * {@inheritDoc}
217         */
218        @Override
219        public void append(StringBuilder a, CharSequence csq, int start, int end) {
220                a.append(csq, start, end);
221        }
222
223        /**
224         * {@inheritDoc}
225         */
226        @Override
227        public void append(StringBuilder a, char c) {
228                a.append(c);
229        }
230
231        /**
232         * {@inheritDoc}
233         */
234        @Override
235        public void append(StringBuilder a, short s) {
236                a.append(s);
237        }
238
239        /**
240         * {@inheritDoc}
241         */
242        public void append(StringBuilder a, int i) {
243                a.append(i);
244        }
245
246        /**
247         * {@inheritDoc}
248         */
249        public void append(StringBuilder a, long l) {
250                a.append(l);
251        }
252
253        /**
254         * {@inheritDoc}
255         */
256        public void append(StringBuilder a, double d) {
257                a.append(d);
258        }
259
260        /**
261         * {@inheritDoc}
262         */
263        public void append(StringBuilder a, boolean b) {
264                a.append(b);
265        }
266
267}
268
269class AppenderAppendable<A extends Appendable> implements Appendable {
270
271        private final Appender<A> appender;
272
273        private final A appendable;
274
275        public AppenderAppendable(Appender<A> appender, A appendable) {
276                super();
277                this.appender = appender;
278                this.appendable = appendable;
279        }
280
281        @Override
282        public @NonNull Appendable append(@Nullable CharSequence csq) throws @Nullable IOException {
283                appender.append(appendable, csq);
284                return this;
285        }
286
287        @Override
288        public @NonNull Appendable append(@Nullable CharSequence csq, int start, int end) throws IOException {
289                appender.append(appendable, csq, start, end);
290                return this;
291        }
292
293        @Override
294        public @NonNull Appendable append(char c) throws IOException {
295                appender.append(appendable, c);
296                return this;
297        }
298
299}
